subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Anybody getting 'helper' names from EVP Maker?
author: bruce halliday

Hi Margaret,
 
What I meant was, through all of us doing research, someone=
 or a number of us are bound to receive
a message or messages that will exp=
lain what and if there is an explanation for the tech turmoil some
have bee=
n experiencing including myself. And that the answers and or messages will =
most likely be recorded 
by the researchers so we can collaborate them and =
come up with a generally accepted theory.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: ITCdeadpeople@...: Sat, 29 Mar 2008 16:31=
:54 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Anybody getting 'helper' names from EVP Mak=
er?




Hi Bruce. The reason I asked about the techs is, my normal guys are=
 David & Patrick, and a woman whose name I've never been told. They come th=
rough on the MiniBox or manual radio sweep. It seems I have a different tec=
h group (five people) when I work with more traditional EVP methods, which =
I discovered nearly three years ago. I thought it interesting to have someo=
ne named Arthur come through via EVPM, as the name is new to me. I've long =
suspected that perhaps different groups assist with different technologies.=
 For instance, I have one team that seems to be unique to my work with ligh=
t (phototransistor modified recorder and battery operated plasma globe comb=
o.)I'm not sure what you mean by "come up with the answer, backed up by a f=
ile." Margaret--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <paranormalinv=
estigating@...> wrote:>> > Margaret,> > I have had the same two techs since=
 I began this research.> Mike and Lisa, we built a very strong and trusting=
 relationship.> Within about the last month I have hardly heard from mike a=
nd received > numerous message that lead ME to believe he has moved on, eit=
her to> help less experienced researchers or to a higher spiritual level.> =
> There is definitely a restructuring of the techs and guides going on.> I =
am not the only researcher experiencing this phenomenon.> > I still however=
 receive messages from Lisa in every box session.> To answer your original =
question, given the fact that I have only done 2 EVPM sessions > No I have =
not received any conformation of either of my techs, and of course with the=
 > nature of the robotic sound that the EVPM file omits, Recognisable voice=
 tones or patterns> are not possible.> > But the experiments continue, and =
hopefully one of us will come up with the answer, backed> up by a file.> > =
Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: ITCdeadpeople@...: Sat, 29 Mar=
 2008 03:49:39 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Anybody getting 'helper' names from =
EVP Maker?> > > > > Hi All. I'm wondering if anyone else has received a 'te=
ch' or 'helper' name(s) while using EVP Maker?Just thought I'd toss this ou=
t there.... Last night I asked who was speaking using the EVP Maker and SJ =
Allophones combo, and received the direct answer, "Arthur." That's a bit sh=
ort for my preference, as I like to rule out coincidence, but there was a f=
ollowup statement made in the same session which surprised me, "Arthur can =
help you." I think when using sweep and similar techniques that relevance t=
o session content is really important as an aid in ruling our false positiv=
es, so this followup comment helped sway me toward the possibility of this =
having been intentional communication. It's been fascinating to work with t=
his combination the last couple of days!Margaret > > > > > > > ____________=
______________________________________________> Windows Live Hotmail is giv=
ing away Zunes.> http://www.windowslive-hotmail.com/ZuneADay/?locale=3Den-U=
S&ocid=3DTXT_TAGLM_Mobile_Zune_V3>
